name: createTimespan
description: Returns a value that defines a time period, represented by a numeric (double) where 1 equals 1 day. You can add or subtract it from other date/time objects and use it with the cachedWithin attribute of cfquery.

params.name: days
params.description: The number of days ranging from 0 to 32768

examples.title: Use of createTimespan in a cfquery
examples.description: The createTimespan function is useful in the cachedwithin attribute of cfquery.
examples.code:
<cfquery name = "GetParks" datasource = "cfdocexamples" cachedWithin = "#createTimespan(0, 6, 0, 0)#"> 
 SELECT PARKNAME, REGION, STATE 
 FROM Parks 
 ORDER by ParkName, State 
 </cfquery>

examples.title: The createTimespan function returns a numeric value
examples.description: Passing 6 hours, or a quarter of a day returns a double representing 1/4

examples.title: Adding a date and a timestamp
examples.description: Instead of using dateAdd you could add a timestamp to a date object
